thread.title: MTV VMAs: Nicki Minaj, Taylor Swift Twitter feud over nominations |
thread.title_full: MTV VMAs: Nicki Minaj, Taylor Swift Twitter feud over nominations | The Advertiser

author: Nadia Salemme
title: MTV VMAs: Nicki Minaj, Taylor Swift Twitter feud over nominations |
text:
HER anaconda got none.
Nicki Minaj has called out MTV for snubbing her videos for Anaconda and Feeling Myself from the Video of the Year category at the VMAs.
She took aim at the music channel for honouring â€œother girlsâ€ who have women with â€œvery slim bodiesâ€ in their music videos. Taylor Swift, who was nominated for nine awards, took it personally.
The rapper and actor, 32, made headlines with the provocative video for her song Anaconda , which featured a lot of booty and Minaj grinding on rapper Drakeâ€™s lap.
But unlike Taylor Swiftâ€™s Bad Blood , Minajâ€™s clip was only nominated for Best Female Video - not Video of the Year.
Nicki Minaj is not impressed with MTV. Source: Getty Images
Tay is an awards show favourite. Source: AFP
Minaj took aim at the music channel for honouring â€œother girlsâ€ who celebrate women with â€œvery slim bodiesâ€ in their music videos.
Taylor Swift, who was nominated for nine awards, took the tweets personally.

@NICKIMINAJ I've done nothing but love & support you. It's unlike you to pit women against each other. Maybe one of the men took your slot..
â€” Taylor Swift (@taylorswift13) July 21, 2015
Huh? U must not be reading my tweets. Didn't say a word about u. I love u just as much. But u should speak on this. @taylorswift13
â€” NICKI MINAJ (@NICKIMINAJ) July 21, 2015
Oh but trust me. I'll be on that stage to collect my awards for vid of the year. Feeling Myself & Anaconda. ğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜ŠğŸ˜Š

QueenBey hit me about Anaconda after the IG snippet was released saying how much she loved it. She was also VERY hands on w/FeelingMyself ğŸ˜Š

I'm not always confident. Just tired. Black women influence pop culture so much but are rarely rewarded for it. https://t.co/2xOvJzBXJX
